with dark veins running thru it

hug wolf; snuggle wolf; cuddle wolf

You let go right as things were about to start getting awkward.
I'm quite pleased to make your acquaintance.

talk wolf; talk seagull; talk ape

It's more comfortable than you expected.

It looks to be a sheer cliff dropping hundreds of feet to large rocks and angry ocean below.
A white, sandy beach lays to the south.  Further out to sea a half sunken ship sits in the waves.
The northern part of the island appears to be dense jungle. You can barely make out movement.
Dense jungle.  You see a large ape swinging among the trees.
A half-sunken pirate ship that's seen better days.
A small rural village consisting of many huts.
Nothing but beautiful blue as far as the eye can see.
Angry ocean beats agaisnt huge boulders, so close you can almost taste it.
You spy nothing out of the ordinary.
Ocean as far as the eye can see.
The heights slowly slope back down slowly to gentle, rolling hills.
A three foot wide ledge, perhaps long enough that you could lay down, perhaps not. Vines cover much of the cliff face.
Are you Tarzan now? Perhaps you might climb them though.
go vines; climb vines; go vine; climb vines
You cling to the vine, it's a long way down. The safety of the ledge is beside you to the west.
You cling to the vine, it's a long way down.

The room is filled with treasure.  Too many chests to count, each one bursting with gold, gems, and precious metals.
You search, but it seems there truly is no dragon standing guard.

x cliff; x edge; x plunge; x down
You approach the edge and peek.  Seems like a long ways down...
You stand in a large clearing, bordered by dense jungle to the west. A huge boulder clings resolutely to the edge of the cliff.
You sit down for a moment and ponder the life choices that led you to this point...
You approach the edge and peek.  Seems like a long ways down...
You stand in a quiet grove filled with flowers. A single massive tree stands at the center.
You stand in a burnt grove filled full of nothing but ashes and acrid smoke.
You stand resolute at the helm as a wave unlike any you've ever seen rushes towards you. Your old grand-daddy told tales of waves like this - <ship killers<15>> he called them.

You whisper your fearful request to a higher power and hope someone is listening.

yell stranger; scream stranger; shout stranger

Up high above.  You can see it periodically when lightning flashes across the sky.

You close your eyes and try to will yourself awake.

Half the room is submerged beneath dark water.

swim water; check water; feel water; search water
You feel around beneath the water and grasp a small object.
You feel around beneath the water, but find nothing.
The seagull slightly dips it's head as if taking a bow.
A patch covers one eye and a parrot rests on his shoulder. Yes, the captain is a bit stereotypical, but you'd never say that to his face.
A bit of blond sandy hair escape from under a red bandana. His smile may be missing a few teeth, but is as still friendly as ever.
The frail old man wears in a dingy cloak.  He leans on a gnarled walking stick, as if it were a cane.
He wears a black cape and grips a bloodwood staff.  He smiles and makes a very deep bow.
A dire wolf with a light grey mane and deep <golden<#fc3>> eyes.  It yips at you and wags its tail in a friendly fashion.
It towers above you, with smooth white bark and light crimson blossoms.  Every so slowly the limbs drop a bit and then rise again.
The ape scratches it's head and looks back at you.
Likely used for drawing the water up from the well.
It looks like hasn't been used in some time. Seems deep.
You see the remains of fruit that rotted long ago and faded fabrics.
A large kettle hangs over the fireplace, smells like grandma's chili.
Looks like it hasn't been used in many years.
Appears to be a small, primitive village, but it's too quiet.  You'll need to enter to learn more.
The hut before you is larger than the rest, but otherwise similar.
The large creature is bound upon the altar and appears injured. It looks towards you, or is that merely your imagination?
He wears a black cape and holds a bloodwood staff. He is slowly speaking the words of some sort of incantation or spell.
Very rare, from the Blood Forest. It is said that removing a single limb from that forest traps and binds the tree's soul to the wood for eternity.
The bloodwood staff is at 7 feet long and a dark redish brown. Red mists swirl inside the staff.
The wizard's black cape is blowing about madly in the wind.
A massive moonstone altar.  It glows a bright blueish yellow in the moonlight.
A full moon; you swear it looms larger than usual.
The moonlight feels as if it carries a slight chill.
A stormy sea swirls and churns far below.
A massive bonfire lights the night, yet provides no warmth.
Appears to be the remains of a large bonfire from many moons ago. This would be the perfect spot to build a signal fire.
A massive moonstone altar. An impossible crack intersects it from top to bottom.
It almost looks as if it was violently torn in half. What forces could do such a thing?
Slightly bluer than limestone; glows when exposed to moonlight; known to be almost indestructable. The superstitious say it posses magical properties.
A dire wolf with a light grey mane and deep <golden<#fc3>> eyes.
It towers above you, with smooth white bark and light crimson blossoms. It could easily be thousands of years old - or older.
You wander among the flowers. Such <impossible hues<#r>> and shades of color, and a rich smell of chocolate and sunshine.
Dead. The life force you sensed before is gone.
You wizard's staff is broken in half and powerless.
A subject of debate among the crew.  They boarded at the last moment and have kept to themselves.  An old, gnarled walking stick never leaves their side.

The wheel is hand-crafted with the finest Darkwood from the Isle of blah blah blah... honestly you weren't paying all that much attention when the Captain blathered on and on about it during the tour.
It extends upwards into the dark night. You know someone is manning the crow's nest, but don't envy them.
It's attached to leather cordage and seems cold to the touch.
A small, smooth red pebble{reminds_of_eye}. It feels hot to the touch, as if it was alive.
A small, smooth, blue pebble{reminds_of_eye}. It feels hot to the touch, as if it was alive.
A bit overgrown, but obviously it was once a well-worn path.
The white sand glitters as if inviting you back to the safety of the beach.
It'd be tight, but you believe you could wiggle thru if you gave it a shot.
A large outcropping of rock extends onto the beach.
A small pool of crystal clear water. You see your reflection - not one of your better days.
A long rowboat oar; used for paddling.
Coconuts are delicious. But they are up too high.
Assorted debris from the wreck. Nothing useful at the moment.
Reminds you of picking up seashells as a child.
One of the stones from the strange pile.
A pile of perhaps 100 smooth, rounded stones.
The ship's wheel. You must have never even let go - your grand-daddy would be so proud.
A beautiful blue frosted glass bottle that looks as if it's been tossed on the waves for years.
A beautiful blue frosted glass bottle that looks as if it's been tossed on the waves for years.  There is a message inside.
Massive solid oak chest (locked). Perhaps you could smash it open?
A small handful of gold coins.
Poetry and love letters to the Captain's old girlfriend.
Sunbleached and rough, been drifting a while.
A huge blaze, it should be possible to see the smoke for miles.
So much treasure, you half expect to find a dragon lurking around the corner.
There are far too many to count.
Fit for a king, or at least a duke.
It's massive.  Looking closer you notice that rough and uneven steps carved into the boulder lead downwards.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you.  Strangely, it appears to be missing its eyes.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you.  Strangely, it appears to be missing its eyes.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you. Its eyes are a dull gold color.
The crumbled remains of the statue litter the clearing.
Two dozen large stones each the size of your head form a circle around the statue.
A spyglass, good for looking long distances.
This huge tome is where the Captain logged the missions.
Just an ordinary candle, smells like honey.
For now, scrap paper. Perhaps useful if you ever get off this island.
Good for chopping up wood, you suppose.
The Crows Nest is up there.

You imagine you hear the terrifying roar of a leviathan.
The frigid wind whips through your hair.
In the distance you hear crashing waves.
The ship violently rocks to and fro.
If there was ever a time for prayer...
The ship lurches from side to side, almost as if possessed.
The ship groans and strains, trying to avoid being torn apart.
If there were ever a time for speeches, it's now.
You fear you may never see your beloved Lucy again.
You hear a fellow crewmate cry out in the night.
You really wish you'd used the restroom earlier.
You imagine the ship being torn apart.
Several cats run madly across the deck meowing fearfully.
You see your life flashing before your eyes.
You regret the life choices that brought you here.
At the last moment you close your eyes and attempt to find your happy place - hoping to drown out the terrible noise of the boat splitting in two and the terrified screams of the crew.
Sadly, you fail, but mercifully the darkness soon claims you...
Kneeling down you dig a small hole and gently plant the acorn.
Was this somehow all part of a grand master plan?
Were you an ally of the grove or an unwitting pawn of the wizard...
You worry you may never know.
You notice the wizard's bloodwood staff laying nearby, broken in half.
<A thought enters unbidden into your mind.<13>>
You imagine the good you could accomplish with such powers...
You whistle idly as you collect both halves of the staff.
You depart the burnt grove confident of rescue and oddly certain of long life.

The last thing you remember is a vicious growling, as if all the beasts of the earth cried out with a singular voice...
...and then it all fades to black...

The wizard steps forward, raises his bloodwood staff...

- type '<I<6>>' or '<INVENTORY<6>>' to see what you hold (and wear).
- type '<GET<6>> <thing<#da5>>' to pick up an item.
- type '<DROP<6>> <thing<#da5>>' to drop or place an item.
- type '<ACHIEVE<6>>' to see your game achievements.
- type '<STATS<6>>' to see game stats (moves, etc).
- type '<TUTORIAL ON<6>>' to turn tutorial hints on.
- type '<TUTORIAL OFF<6>>' to turn the tutorial off.
- type '<LOAD<6>>' or '<SAVE<6>>' to load or save a game.
Hello, I'm your friendly tutorial. I'll help you learn how to play if you're new to text adventure games.
You can shut me up at any time with <TUTORIAL OFF<6>>, so if you're on the fence, perhaps let me try to help?
You are skipping the tutorial. A few final things:
- this game uses a simple verb/noun parser.
- commands are never more than two words: <NORTH<6>>, <EAT FOOD<6>>, etc.
- during the game you can type <HELP<6>> at any time for basic help.
This game may include fantasy violence (both direct and implied).
Understood.  I hope you find another game to play, good luck!

with dark veins running thru it

You're deep in the jungle.  Huge tropical trees surround you on all sides. It's easy to get lost here.
It's too dark to see much.
When ready to depart, type <THE END<6>> at any time to finish.
The small cast of this grand narrative stands before you.
<As you stare, smoke rises; then a sudden bright flash... and he's gone.<13>>
You walk about shaking hands with everyone, the wolf even raises his paw for you.
The seagull merely looks at you quizically.
You lean in for a kiss...
...the wolf happily licks your face and slobbers all over you.
You pet the wolf and rub in behind the ears affectionately.
It whines happily then gives you a growl just for show.
hug wolf; snuggle wolf; cuddle wolf
You squeeze the wolf tight.  It's fur is incredibly warm and soft.
You let go right as things were about to start getting awkward.
I'm quite pleased to make your acquaintance.
Sorry about my 'pitiful pet' smack down earlier, merely playing my role to the fullest, ya know how it is.
It was my honor to be your captain thru the storm.
talk wolf; talk seagull; talk ape
A beach of beautiful white sand extends along the shoreline to the east and west.  Further to the north is the jungle.
A beach of beautiful white sand.
A beach of beautiful white sand. There is a rocky outcropping to the north.
A beach of beautiful white sand.
A beach of beautiful white sand.
A small crevice disappears downwards into the rock.
go crevice; enter crevice; wiggle crevice
You are standing in a small cave. {beach_cave_description}
As the light fills up the small room, the bear disappears; it was just a shadow.
You washed ashore here. Further south out to sea a half sunken shipwreck rises from the waves.
The waves look a bit angry.
x ship; x shipwreck; x south; x flag
A black skull and crossbones flutters in the wind. You wonder if you could swim that far.
You swim out to the ship.
How? You can't exactly walk to the ship.
You swim out to the ship.
It's pretty far out.  You aren't feeling strong or lucky enough at the moment.
You wake up with a mouth full of sand; your body half in, half out of the cold sea.  You have never been happier to be alive.
You can barely stand. Perhaps crawl?
You can't see anything from how you're laying but sand.
You spit out some sand. You're very thirsty.
You're flat on your face, but it's cold.
You claw your way slowly out of the water and onto dry land...\n ...then collapse exhausted.
Exactly! This game uses a simple parser; commands are 1 or 2 words, always. Most commands will be verb/noun pairs, such as <EAT FOOD<6>> or <ATTACK BEAR<6>>.
The village surrounds you on all sides, but it's far too quiet - like a ghost town.
get fruit; get fabric; look fruit; look fabric
It's far too old and decayed to be of any use.
drop stone; drop pebble; drop rock
You find a small pebble nearby and drop it into the well.  You hear a splash.
To the north stands a large hut.
Small huts surround both sides of the street.
Small huts surround both sides of the street.
Small huts surround both sides of the street.
This hut is homey, yet spacious - larger than the others. A thick layer of dust covers everything.
You swipe your finger across the top of a surface.  Yep, dusty.
It's small and you wouldn't fit.  You don't possess the Christmas magics.
It's more comfortable than you expected.
Ok, but just a quick nap...
A small footpath leads north into the jungle.  To the south is the beach.
look water; drink water; get water
There is no water here, you'll need to find some elsewhere.
Jungle surrounds you.  To the north is the sacred grove.
There is a small village here.
Gently sloping hills rise up to great heights further west. You see a village further east.
A full moon hangs high above.  The wind whips at you, threatening to cast you off the cliff and into the sea.
Touching the altar brought you here, but it does not seem to be how you must return...
listen spell; listen incantation; listen words; listen _
You can't make out the words.
You can't seem to physically move from this place.
Yet somehow you are certain you could leave at anytime, merely by closing your eyes.
close eyes; shut eyes; blink eyes
You close your eyes... slowly the cold wind and rain recede until there is only silence...
You're not certain of the injury, but the wolf looks like it's in pain.
save wolf; help wolf; free wolf; unbind wolf
The urge to intervene is strong...
Yet some part of you knows these events cannot be changed.
attack wizard; fight wizard; hit wizard; stop wizard; throw knife; stab wizard; kill wizard

Yet some part of you knows these events cannot be changed.

The highest point of the island, the view is spectacular.
There is something hiding at the very bottom of the crack.
...and suddenly you are here, but not here.
It looks to be a sheer cliff dropping hundreds of feet to large rocks and angry ocean below.
A white, sandy beach lays to the south.  Further out to sea a half sunken ship sits in the waves.
The northern part of the island appears to be dense jungle. You can barely make out movement.
Dense jungle.  You see a large ape swinging among the trees.
A half-sunken pirate ship that's seen better days.
A small rural village consisting of many huts.
Nothing but beautiful blue as far as the eye can see.
Angry ocean beats agaisnt huge boulders, so close you can almost taste it.
You spy nothing out of the ordinary.
Ocean as far as the eye can see.
The heights slowly slope back down slowly to gentle, rolling hills.
A three foot wide ledge, perhaps long enough that you could lay down, perhaps not. Vines cover much of the cliff face.
Are you Tarzan now? Perhaps you might climb them though.
go vines; climb vines; go vine; climb vines
You cling to the vine, it's a long way down. The safety of the ledge is beside you to the west.
You cling to the vine, it's a long way down.
You cling to the vine, it's still a long way down. A dark crevice seems to lead directly into the cliff.
The passage narrows then heads downwards into the rock. Behind you are the vines.
The room is filled with treasure.  Too many chests to count, each one bursting with gold, gems, and precious metals.
You search, but it seems there truly is no dragon standing guard.
The jungle ends abruptly with a two-hundred foot plunge to rocky shores below. There is no obvious way down.
x cliff; x edge; x plunge; x down
You approach the edge and peek.  Seems like a long ways down...
You stand in a large clearing, bordered by dense jungle to the west. A huge boulder clings resolutely to the edge of the cliff.
You sit down for a moment and ponder the life choices that led you to this point...
You approach the edge and peek.  Seems like a long ways down...
You stand in a quiet grove filled with flowers. A single massive tree stands at the center.
You stand in a burnt grove filled full of nothing but ashes and acrid smoke.
You stand resolute at the helm as a wave unlike any you've ever seen rushes towards you. Your old grand-daddy told tales of waves like this - <ship killers<15>> he called them.
<You've been meaning to speak to them, but never found the time.<13>>
You whisper your fearful request to a higher power and hope someone is listening.
You can't really drop anything in this place...
You dare not leave your post.
But why in the heck would you want to be up in the air in a storm like this?
Retreating below deck sounds great, but you dare not leave your post.
You consider assuming command by force, but have second thoughts.  Is a mutiny truly the answer?
Bad boys, bad boys, what ya gonna do
You reach for your knife... but have second thoughts.  Is mutiny truly the answer here?
Bad boys, bad boys, what ya gonna do
No, duty compells you to stay.  That's the Captain's call, not yours.
walk plank; jump overboard; jump water; jump ship; swim _
Surely things aren't that bad yet?
The Drunken Revenge. She's gotten you thru thick and thin in the past - perhaps she'll pull thru yet.
x wave; x waves; x sea; x water
The wave approaching must be at least as tall as four of your own vessel stacked mast to mast. A huge wall of angry water.
piss pants; pee pants; wet pants; pee yourself; wet yourself
The firstmate looks at you a awkwardly.
...but at least the warmth running down your leg briefly wards off the chill of the night air.
You were never one for long speeches.
They stand at the railing, staring into the ocean, seemingly unbothered by the violence of the storm.
yell stranger; scream stranger; shout stranger
You yell, casting your voice towards the stranger.
Slowly they turn and you see eyes...
...like staring into a deep, dark abyss with no bottom.
<A spider web of lightning flashes across the sky.<14>>
...and when you look back the stranger is gone.
Your momma always told ya get a grip on that overactive imagination of yours.
talk firstmate; speak firstmate; look firstmate
says the first mate with a silly grin.
You recall the beautiful, sunny days you spent swabbing that deck in the past. You should have appreciated them more.
You don't see one (yet), you just thought you heard one.
Could also be your overactive imagination...
You notice several of the felines hiding under a tarp.
Just a tarp. Cats are hiding under it.
Up high above.  You can see it periodically when lightning flashes across the sky.
The only killer you see is the wave in the distance.
Is this really the right time to share your feelings?
talk captain; speak captain; look captain
Yet you see the fear in his eyes.
You spin the wheel trying to alter course, but deep inside you know it won't matter.
You close your eyes and try to will yourself awake.
The ship is half sunken, but the skull and crossbones still flies high. To the north is the beach.
The skull and crossbones still flies proudly in the wind.
Half the room is submerged beneath dark water.
You wonder what could be hiding beneath the surface.
swim water; check water; feel water; search water
You feel around beneath the water and grasp a small object.
You feel around beneath the water, but find nothing.
The seagull slightly dips it's head as if taking a bow.
A patch covers one eye and a parrot rests on his shoulder. Yes, the captain is a bit stereotypical, but you'd never say that to his face.
A bit of blond sandy hair escape from under a red bandana. His smile may be missing a few teeth, but is as still friendly as ever.
The frail old man wears in a dingy cloak.  He leans on a gnarled walking stick, as if it were a cane.
He wears a black cape and grips a bloodwood staff.  He smiles and makes a very deep bow.
A dire wolf with a light grey mane and deep <golden<#fc3>> eyes.  It yips at you and wags its tail in a friendly fashion.
It towers above you, with smooth white bark and light crimson blossoms.  Every so slowly the limbs drop a bit and then rise again.
The ape scratches it's head and looks back at you.
It looks like hasn't been used in some time. Seems deep.
You see the remains of fruit that rotted long ago and faded fabrics.
A large kettle hangs over the fireplace, smells like grandma's chili.
Looks like it hasn't been used in many years.
Appears to be a small, primitive village, but it's too quiet.  You'll need to enter to learn more.
The hut before you is larger than the rest, but otherwise similar.
The large creature is bound upon the altar and appears injured. It looks towards you, or is that merely your imagination?
He wears a black cape and holds a bloodwood staff. He is slowly speaking the words of some sort of incantation or spell.
Very rare, from the Blood Forest. It is said that removing a single limb from that forest traps and binds the tree's soul to the wood for eternity.
The bloodwood staff is at 7 feet long and a dark redish brown. Red mists swirl inside the staff.
The wizard's black cape is blowing about madly in the wind.
A massive moonstone altar.  It glows a bright blueish yellow in the moonlight.
A full moon; you swear it looms larger than usual.
The moonlight feels as if it carries a slight chill.
A stormy sea swirls and churns far below.
A massive bonfire lights the night, yet provides no warmth.
Appears to be the remains of a large bonfire from many moons ago. This would be the perfect spot to build a signal fire.
A massive moonstone altar. An impossible crack intersects it from top to bottom.
It almost looks as if it was violently torn in half. What forces could do such a thing?
Slightly bluer than limestone; glows when exposed to moonlight; known to be almost indestructable. The superstitious say it posses magical properties.
A dire wolf with a light grey mane and deep <golden<#fc3>> eyes.
It towers above you, with smooth white bark and light crimson blossoms. It could easily be thousands of years old - or older.
You wander among the flowers. Such <impossible hues<#r>> and shades of color, and a rich smell of chocolate and sunshine.
Dead. The life force you sensed before is gone.
You wizard's staff is broken in half and powerless.
A subject of debate among the crew.  They boarded at the last moment and have kept to themselves.  An old, gnarled walking stick never leaves their side.

The wheel is hand-crafted with the finest Darkwood from the Isle of blah blah blah... honestly you weren't paying all that much attention when the Captain blathered on and on about it during the tour.
It extends upwards into the dark night. You know someone is manning the crow's nest, but don't envy them.
It's attached to leather cordage and seems cold to the touch.
A small, smooth red pebble{reminds_of_eye}. It feels hot to the touch, as if it was alive.
A small, smooth, blue pebble{reminds_of_eye}. It feels hot to the touch, as if it was alive.
A bit overgrown, but obviously it was once a well-worn path.
The white sand glitters as if inviting you back to the safety of the beach.
It'd be tight, but you believe you could wiggle thru if you gave it a shot.
A large outcropping of rock extends onto the beach.
A small pool of crystal clear water. You see your reflection - not one of your better days.
A long rowboat oar; used for paddling.
Coconuts are delicious. But they are up too high.
Assorted debris from the wreck. Nothing useful at the moment.
Reminds you of picking up seashells as a child.
One of the stones from the strange pile.
A pile of perhaps 100 smooth, rounded stones.
The ship's wheel. You must have never even let go - your grand-daddy would be so proud.
A beautiful blue frosted glass bottle that looks as if it's been tossed on the waves for years.
A beautiful blue frosted glass bottle that looks as if it's been tossed on the waves for years.  There is a message inside.
Massive solid oak chest (locked). Perhaps you could smash it open?
A small handful of gold coins.
Poetry and love letters to the Captain's old girlfriend.
Sunbleached and rough, been drifting a while.
A huge blaze, it should be possible to see the smoke for miles.
So much treasure, you half expect to find a dragon lurking around the corner.
There are far too many to count.
Fit for a king, or at least a duke.
It's massive.  Looking closer you notice that rough and uneven steps carved into the boulder lead downwards.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you.  Strangely, it appears to be missing its eyes.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you.  Strangely, it appears to be missing its eyes.
In the middle of the clearing is a statue of a massive wolf, every bit as tall as you. Its eyes are a dull gold color.
The crumbled remains of the statue litter the clearing.
Two dozen large stones each the size of your head form a circle around the statue.
A spyglass, good for looking long distances.
This huge tome is where the Captain logged the missions.
Just an ordinary candle, smells like honey.
For now, scrap paper. Perhaps useful if you ever get off this island.
Good for chopping up wood, you suppose.
The Crows Nest is up there.
Looks like an acorn. Smells like an acorn.
It's too dark to proceed any further without a light source.

^c^your eyes could steal this sailor from the sea,

light fire; set fire; start fire; make fire; build fire; set fire; burn wood

You need matches or some way to ignite the fire.
light fire; set fire; start fire; make fire

You'll put that on your list; just as soon as you get off this island.
You cannot.  Some magic ties it to this place.
You sit down on the bed and slowly thumb thru the pages.
I depart now to face the wizard with what little courage and magics I possess.
The wolf is as old as time; protector of our people, guardian of the island and sacred grove.
This dark figure has held many names and his tales would fill many books.
The wizard tricked the wolf, gouged its eyes (stealing its powers), and then placed it into a dark, dreamless slumber.
There stands a wise, sacred tree in the center of the island that we worship.
Surely the way to the grove will remain elusive to the wizard. It must.
I do not know what has become of my people.
I fear I will never know.
All of this was long ago foretold... also that one day a hero would come - to right the old wrongs.
Seek the wolf... and perhaps then the tree would offer help...

eat bird; cook bird; roast bird
